definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: hang, be low, languish (NH Hiph. thin, thin out vines, etc.; As. dalâlu, be weak, humble Zim:Bp 74. 97; Ar. dal=a direct, guide, dul=a, be directed, guided; daldala put in motion, commotion; tadaldala be in motion, hang, dangle; also dal=un amorous, coquettish, gesture or behaviour of women)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. [[דֵּלּֽתִי]] Ps 116:6, [[דַּלּוֹתִי]] Ps 142:7; 1 pl. [[דַּלּוֹנוּ]] Ps 79:8, [[דָּֽלֲלוּ]] Is 19:6, [[דַּלּוּ]] Is 38:14, Job 28:4 (on [[דַּלְיוּ]] Pr 26:7 cf. [[דָּלָה]]);—hang, ‘depend’, Job 28:4 (of one descending a miner's shaft ‖[[נׇעוּ]]); be low, of streams Is 19:6 (‖[[חָֽרְבוּ]]); be low, brought low, metaph. of distress Ps 79:8, Ps 116:6, Ps 142:7; languish, of eyes, look languishingly (Che) Is 38:14.—

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Impf. [[יִדַּל]] Is 17:4, [[וַיִּדַּל]] Ju Jdg 6:6, —be brought low, laid low, Ju Jdg 6:6 fig. of Israel; Is 17:4 of glory of Jacob.
